title: Flank Steak and Kale Tacos with Pico De Gallo Salsa
directions: Place marinade ingredients in a large bowl and whisk to combine (or use a sealable freezer bag). Submerge steak in marinade, cover dish or close bag, and marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight.
While steak is marinating, make pico de gallo: Place salsa ingredients in a medium-sized bowl; mix to combine. Set aside.

To prepare kale, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add onions and cook until soft (about 4 minutes). Add kale and cook until kale wilts, stirring frequently (about 3 minutes). Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
To cook steak, preheat grill to medium-high. Remove steak from marinade and grill 4 to 7 minutes per side. Remove from grill and let sit 5 minutes; slice diagonally across the grain into thin strips.
Heat tortillas to soften. Fill tortillas with kale mixture, steak and 3 tablespoons pico de gallo and serve immediately.
ingredients: Pinch of salt and pepper (to taste)
1 bunch toscano kale, stemmed and cut into bitesized pieces
